availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Gabriel Netter (Lieutenant Colonel, 15th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry)

body.p: Hartford, Kentucky, soldier. Native of France. Captain in the 26th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) from March 5, 1862 to June 14, 1862. Lieutenant colonel in the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.). Died in battle at Owensboro on September 19, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 393, 403.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky_, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p.202.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0380.
Find A Grave, "Gabriel Netter (June 9, 1836- September 19-1862)," Memorial #120867581, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/120867581(accessed December 19, 2018).
